Westborn Market is a highly-rated grocery store in Dearborn that emphasizes sustainability and local produce

column2: Better Health Store of Dearborn offers a wide variety of herbal, organic, and holistic health products, emphasizing healthy living and sustainability efforts in the community.

column2: The Dearborn Farmers Market focuses on sustainability by offering fresh, locally-produced food options, promoting community health and supporting local farmers. It is a vibrant place where customers can find fresh fruits, vegetables, artisanal goods, and engage with the community, reinforcing sustainable agricultural practices
column7:

column2: Papaya Fruit Market promotes sustainability through its focus on fresh, local produce and supports eco-friendly farming practices, benefiting both the community and the environment.

Offers organic produce, meats, and sustainable seafood, with a focus on eco-friendly practices. ALDI is committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, using 100% green electricity, and increasing packaging recyclability. Eliminated all plastic shopping bags by 2023 to minimize waste.
column5: 24130 Van Born Rd, Dearborn Heights, MI 48125

column2: A community-owned grocery cooperative offering locally sourced food, promoting food education, and fostering sustainable practices.

One of the nation's oldest and largest public markets, offering fresh produce, meats, and other goods. Supports local farmers, urban agriculture, and sustainable freight initiatives to reduce carbon emissions.
column7:

Sunday: June-October: 10 AM-4 PM.
Tuesday: June-October: 9 AM to 3 PM

column2: A holistic shop offering zero-waste skincare with herbal & oil infusions, and USDA organic products that are made-to-order. Based in Detroit but newly opened in February 2024

column2: Sells secondhand goods and undertakes various eco-friendly practices such as encouraging the recycling of used items through donation. It focuses on minimizing waste and promotes sustainable fashion, aligning with the circular economy

column2: Helping Hand Thrift Shop is a family-owned business known for its warm, welcoming atmosphere. By embracing the ethos of reduce, reuse, and recycle, these shops play an important role in promoting environmental stewardship while providing an array of affordable goods. The shop offers a collection of fine and custom jewelry, hats, vintage clothing, and mid-century furniture
column7:
Monday-Saturday: 9 AM - 8 PM
Sunday: 10 AM - 8 PM

column2: Plato’s Closet buys and sells gently used clothes, shoes and accessories, so you can recycle the items you no longer wear and get paid on the spot. We buy styles for all seasons, all day, every day, with no appointment necessary. Each Plato’s Closet location is individually owned and operated by local business owners, so you can feel good about shopping small.
column7:
Monday - Saturday: 10 AM - 9 PM
Sunday: 11 AM - 6 PM

column2: A large thrift store offering a wide variety of used clothing, accessories, and household goods, encouraging eco-friendly shopping practices and waste reduction
A boutique specializing in sustainable, organic, and environmentally-friendly clothing for women and men, promoting eco-conscious fashion choices.

The first of three state-of-the-art community parks in Dearborn, featuring outdoor seating, shaded walkways, wifi, and advanced water management systems. Part of a $29.2 million grant-funded investment to enhance green spaces and promote sustainability.

This scenic 2-mile-long bike path crosses two bridges over the Rouge River, through densely forested woodland and the campus of the University of Michigan-Dearborn, leading to nearby attractions such as Greenfield Village and the Henry Ford Museum.

The Hines Park Trail includes a 20-mile connection from Michigan Ave. (Dearborn) to Northville, featuring paved paths, parks, dog areas, and picnic facilities. The trail runs parallel to Edward Hines Drive and passes through scenic areas
column5: From Dearborn to Northville, along Edward Hines Drive

column2: Ford Field Park offers scenic views of the Rouge River, access to the start of the Rouge River Gateway Trail, large picnic shelters, tennis courts, ball fields, sledding and more.
Crowley Park is a vibrant community park, the park features basketball courts, soccer fields, a splash pad, and picnic areas, offering a variety of outdoor activities for visitors of all ages

Ford Woods Park offers a variety of amenities, including handicap-accessible play equipment, an outdoor pool, ball fields, tennis courts, walking tracks, and picnic areas, making it a family-friendly destination.
Hemlock Raymond Park features a splash pad, sledding hill, basketball and soccer fields, and handicap-accessible amenities, offering something for all age groups.
Lapeer Park is equipped with handicap-accessible features, an outdoor pool, sand volleyball courts, and various sports fields, catering to recreational and competitive needs.
Levagood Park boasts unique features like a natural ice rink, sand volleyball courts, and various other recreational amenities, making it ideal for year-round activities.
The Civic Center Park & Fields combines fitness and leisure with handicap-accessible facilities, pickleball courts, and fitness stations for a well-rounded outdoor experience.

The Suburban Mobility Authority for Regional Transportation (SMART) operates regional bus services throughout Southeast Michigan, including Dearborn. SMART offers the FAST (Frequent Affordable Safe Transit) bus lines along Michigan Avenue with six stops in Dearborn.
column7: Buses run every 30 minutes from 5 AM to midnight

column2: The University of Michigan-Dearborn provides a free shuttle service for students, staff, and faculty. The shuttle connects campus with nearby residential areas and shopping locations.
